documents.document: @terryjstamp @_chriskohler It should be recognised that it has always been hard for young house buyers to make ends meet. No new phenomenon.
@terryjstamp @_chriskohler No. Earlier tweet was relating single wages with house prices.
@terryjstamp @_chriskohler She had a partner who shared repayments.
@Anto1503 @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Backbone of the nation. https://t.co/Of8FZi9rjb
@Anto1503 @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Trades need career planning. Pathways for progression.
@Anto1503 @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Yes. Team job.
@terryjstamp @PuntPal @_chriskohler Whoever said Karratha & Port Hedland was kidding themselves. Perth metro will come back soon.
@Anto1503 @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Overtime money is good. Lucrative.
@Anto1503 @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian They are on a pretty good wicket already. Very expensive hourly rates.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam @guardian Use Google to check my facts.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @petegordon4sir @_chriskohler @australian @illchangethis Compared to what? Australia is still the lucky country.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam @guardian Household income is very different to two average incomes.
@RobinVirant @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Yes. Tradies are the new Dentists.
@BoomersAreEvil @Graham1Sam Try Google. It's all there.
@illchangethis @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian They would.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @illchangethis @_chriskohler @australian Yes. Banks believe more in increased value of houses than your ability to pay back
@petegordon4sir @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian @illchangethis So defeatist.
@MarkPlackett1 @cponzi @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil That's credit cards. No one likes to talk about credit card debt.
@illchangethis @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Incredibly banks will still give you a 30 year loan.
@cponzi @lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler That's always the benchmark.
@cponzi @MarkPlackett1 @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil Most people's biggest purchase.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian It affects everything.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian Yes. House prices are like a clock etc.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam Not according to official statistics.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian Mmmm. It's more complicated. We do need investment to build rentals.
@cponzi @MarkPlackett1 @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil Pretending there is no dosh in Sydney is naive.
@cponzi @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam Wages are matching CPI
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian 15% increase is not guaranteed or an annual thing.
@peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil @Graham1Sam Two 'average' incomes are $150,000.
@cponzi @MarkPlackett1 @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil Demand. When people lose interest in living in Sydney, prices will fall.
@cponzi @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam That's arguable.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian It has been sustained. Nay sayers have been proven wrong.
@peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam @BoomersAreEvil @MarkPlackett1 State government has become dependent on stamp duty revenue.
@Graham1Sam @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris Needing two full time incomes to pay off your mortgage, to me, means you bought the wrong house
@MarkPlackett1 @Graham1Sam @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris Now THATS a scandal.
@Graham1Sam @MarkPlackett1 @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris Achieves nothing but years in the wilderness for all.
@GeorgesStPaul1 @MarkPlackett1 @Graham1Sam Problem is the 'good of the nation' is second to most people's individual struggles.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @MarkPlackett1 Do we really want endless cheap houses further & further out from cities? Is that progress?
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @stoicsnake @_chriskohler @australian Yeah that's what many red faced economists have been saying for years
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam Low (it's not nothing) wage growth ignores fact people get promoted & then earn more.
@BoomersAreEvil @MdmAbsentMinded @_chriskohler @australian @linzcom You can with negative gearing.
@Graham1Sam @BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @MarkPlackett1 I'm less of a fan of that. People do need to have some benefit from saving.
@peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil @Graham1Sam @MarkPlackett1 It will make a big difference. #IMO
@peterfraserbris @MarkPlackett1 @BoomersAreEvil Yes. Currently population growth is exceeding demand.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian Actually the Labor Party has announced a perfectly practical policy. Change is coming.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam @MarkPlackett1 Just change the tax laws. #endnegativegearing
@MdmAbsentMinded @BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler @australian Rents are tied to property values.
@peterfraserbris @MarkPlackett1 @BoomersAreEvil Demand. Prices can't fall in popular cities with limited space.
@Graham1Sam @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil @MarkPlackett1 Even Albo has a second house in Canberra.
@Graham1Sam @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil @MarkPlackett1 Yes. Dutton has a reported $10 million portfolio.
@stoicsnake @43a6f0ce5dac4ea @BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler @australian As long as people think they can't, they won't. Think positive.
@BoomersAreEvil @peterfraserbris @Graham1Sam @MarkPlackett1 Higher stamp duty for investors?
@peterfraserbris @MarkPlackett1 @BoomersAreEvil Catch 22. The longer you wait the higher the buy in price.
@MarkPlackett1 @peterfraserbris @BoomersAreEvil They keep saying the Sydney market will turn. It just keeps going up & up. #demand
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian I get out a lot. You'd be surprised who the entrepreneurs are.
@MarkPlackett1 @BoomersAreEvil @CENTUM Well their houses are now worth a fortune.
@BoomersAreEvil @lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler Or talk to a financial advisor.
@lapuntadelfin @vaughanhealey @_chriskohler Its not really ingrained. Will change.
@vaughanhealey @lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler Not in a limited house market. Demand is always growing.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler Yes. Home ownership is decreasing with population growth.
@BoomersAreEvil Yes. People are now using their superannuation to pay off their house debt & then go on the pension. That's not ideal.
@cponzi @BoomersAreEvil Yelling doesn't get you a house either.
@cponzi @BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler X. We who came after.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler That's a good point. That's an extra impost on young house buyers now.
@DebGroarke Yes. Negative Gearing tax cuts are out of control. Need to be be removed.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler True. Wage growth is a real issue.
@PuntPal @_chriskohler House prices are never going to lower in Sydney. Too much demand.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler Median house cost in Sydney is now over a million I believe? https://t.co/mNm2e2bSXv
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler Old suburbs see little new building.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler It's a politically unpopular tax. Another impost for people struggling with a mortgage. Two sides.
@BoomersAreEvil No one was ever handed a house. Saving is a bitch.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler Not really.
@BoomersAreEvil No obligation to buy a house. Europe has a very low level of home ownership. Australia has an unusually high level.
@BoomersAreEvil 18 is too young. See world, be crazy but then allow three years of hard savings to get deposit. It's worth it.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler No. People get ahead by using the leverage from the increased value of their homes. Salaries aren't everything.
@cponzi @BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler First home owners should buy dog box then a few years later renovate or upgrade.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler Each to their own. I prefer to get advice from people who have done it.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler House prices traditionally double every seven years. That's not new. #oldsaying
@DebGroarke @_chriskohler She had to put up a third deposit. Borrowed $40,000.
@PuntPal @_chriskohler Talking to people is a better way to find your way into home ownership. Practical advice based on experience.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler Yes that is certainly on the cards. They do that in ACT.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler This may shock you but the notion houses are impossibly expensive is not new. At 25 it always is a mountain.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler No, understanding that finding a way into the house market IS hard, requires sacrifices but is worth it.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler Yep city prices are much higher & they grow in value much quicker. Much more competitive market.
@lapuntadelfin @_chriskohler That's a great plan. #not
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler @australian Not really. Point is to make your rent your income. Getting that deposit is everything.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler No. I know hardly anyone who built a house from scratch.
@BoomersAreEvil Seems you are just on a Blame hunt rather than a solutions hunt. #nothelping @_chriskohler
@PuntPal Example was demonstrating house v salary prices from the past. #importantdistinction @_chriskohler
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler Personal anecdote, lived experience, the media & government statistics are all we got.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler That's a different discussion.
@BoomersAreEvil @_chriskohler @australian No, youth of today ARE buying houses. That's what I'm seeing. It's tough, sure but it's happening.
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler Average salary is now over $80,000 a year. #OfficialStatistics
@43a6f0ce5dac4ea @_chriskohler @australian What 'average' tradie is on a grand a week? Please advise. #needsomeworkdone
@holder_glen Damn real life examples. Talking to people is SO last century right? Back to compliant anonymous statistics. #comforting
@timmydownawell Packer ads looks like this: https://t.co/8hARjyWVri
@timmydownawell Ha - no. Not even sure what ad is selling.
@_grante @_chriskohler Have another friend's example. In 1989 Petersham house was bought for $197,000. Salary $20,000. Same, same.
@PolitiScopeOz It went REALLY well! The time did zip along. Congratulations to all. #itworks #auspol
